fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19054].
  {panel}

To improve Confluence's search, please provide an option to resolve all {include} and {excerpt-include} macro content before Confluence indexes whole page content.

h4. Problem

When Confluence indexes page content for searches, it doesn't resolve the content of these inclusions into the page first. Hence, when the user attempts to search for a page based on a term that's actually part of an inclusion's content, then the page that 'hosts' the inclusion will not show up in the search results.

As far as the user is concerned, those terms _are_ on the page when they view it. It's not until the user looks at the page's Wiki Markup when they'll realise that the content is only being referenced via an inclusion macro (and why the search didn't retrieve the 'host' page).

It's often more useful to see _the names/titles_ of these 'host' pages in search results, rather than those of the actual 'inclusion pages' themselves, since 'inclusion pages' (and titles) are typically out of context.

h4. Solution

To improve Confluence's search efficacy, Confluence could provide an admin console option to makes it resolve the content of all \{include\} and \{excerpt-include\} macros first, before it indexes the whole page content.

If Confluence could resolve all inclusions before indexing whole page content, this will provide the following benefits:
* If a user searches for text contained within \{include\} or \{excerpt-include\} macros, the names (and links) of pages that include this content will appear in the search results, rather than just the 'inclusion pages' further down the list of search results.
\\ \\
* If a space uses the new 'Documentation Theme' and a user searches for text contained within \{include\} or \{excerpt-include\} macros using the search box in the TOC column (for example, any one of our product documentation spaces on [CAC|http://confluence.atlassian.com/]), the pages that include this content will appear in the search results, rather than not at all.
\\ \\
*Why would these searches show no results?*
\\ \\
The Documentation Theme requires a 'root page' within the space (from which the TOC is generated) to be set. When you start viewing pages within the space, the search box in the TOC column (by design) will only search pages contained within the 'root page' hierarchy. 'Inclusion pages', however, are typically kept outside this hierarchy to prevent them appearing in the TOC. Hence, if you use this Documentation Theme search box to look for terms contained within an 'inclusion page', you're likely to get no results.
fields.summary: Confluence search results should include content added to page via the  {include} and {excerpt-include} macros

fields.description:
At the moment, the personal sidebar is rendered within the main context, this means it does not have access to the action variables. For example, the personal sidebar can't properly use the Web Menu items.

We should render the personal sidebar the same way we render the other sidebars.
fields.summary: Render the personal sidebar within the context of the page or blogpost

fields.description:
Some customers have reported Confluence performance and installation issues when using using Java 6 Update 18 64 bit. The problem may also be evident when using Java 32 bit.

h3. Resolution 

Upgrade to Java 6 Update 23 or higher

h3. Workaround(s):
- If using Update 18 or later, add to your {{setenv.bat/sh}}: 
{{-XX:CompileCommand=exclude,org/apache/velocity/runtime/directive/Foreach,render}}

Please see [tomcat forum|http://www.mail-archive.com/users@tomcat.apache.org/msg77746.html] for relevant discussion on the issue.
fields.summary: Confluence performance / installation issue when using Java 6 u18 - u22

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19048].
  {panel}

It would be good if Confluence streamed the zipfile of attachments directly to the client rather than spooling to disk. This saves on disk space and there is nothing to clean up in the case where the client terminates the download.

Currently the "download all attachements" feature can leave a lot of incomplete downloads behind in the temp directory. See the example below.

Background - We had an issue on CAC over the weekend where crawlers were hitting the "download all attachments" link. On pages with a lot of attachments this produces a lot of crud in the temp dir (in this case over 100GB). 

{noformat}
$ ls -latr download*.zip

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19044].
  {panel}

The action hierarchy for restore is as follows:

* ConfluenceActionSupport 
** AbstractBackupRestoreAction 
*** AbstractImportAction
**** AbstractFileRestoreAction
***** RestoreFileAction
****** SetupRestoreFileAction
***** RestoreLocalFileAction
****** RestorePageAction
****** SetupRestoreAction
**** ImportSnipSnapAction

Add in the fact that ExportUtils is difficult to unit test, and you get annoying code to maintain. Definitely needs to be restructured.

It isn't possible to visualize emf images. Confluence doesn't support to show emf images on pages.

It's necessary just include the following row in confluence\WEB-INF\classes\mime.types file:

bq. image/x-emf emf

Just to infom: IE supports the visualization of emf images, but firefox doesn't.

fields.description:
When you "Upload and Restore" spaces, it correctly picks up the space key and when it rebuilds the ancestor table it only rebuilds for that space. 

However if you place the space export in the restore folder and "Restorea backup from filesystem", it does not pick up the space and rebuilds the entire ancestor table (which on large instances can cause a hang for 2 hours or more. 

The workaround is to use "Upload and Restore" for space imports.
fields.summary: Restore behaves differently to Upload and Restore for restoring spaces.

{code}

h3. Possible Cause and Resolution

From some previous support cases, we found that this error can occur when Confluence's web.xml is out of date. So if you have updated the web.xml and just copied that file when you upgraded to 3.2 you will see this problem. Essentially, the following entry must exist in web.xml:

{code:xml}
<filter-mapping>
    <filter-name>servletcontextthreadlocal</filter-name>
    <url-pattern>/rest/*</url-pattern>
</filter-mapping>
{code}

This only happens when user is using *ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator* authenticator. However, the *ConfluenceLDAPGroupJoiningAuthenticator* authenticator do not have this issue.

fields.description:
Providing the ability to create and export Confluence content and/or attachments to EndNote could be useful for academic customers.

Specific request from customer:

{quote}
"IN a traditional shared drive, a fully functional Endnote library and its associated PDFs can be dragged and dropped into a folder as if it was on a desktop. But this functionality seems to be lost with online storage solutions such as confluence and teamspace. As Simon was explaining the other day, this stems from the fact that an Endnote library is a collection of many files.

There is a version of Endnote called 'Endnote WEB' that seems to be set up to provide online file sharing, but one key feature that is lost in this version is the PDF file attachments. (I'm not sure if this is for copyright reasons)

So in a ideal world, we would like to be able to drag and drop a fully functional endnote library onto a online shared drive, enabling all members to access, add to and download PDF references from this resource."

From my interpretation from the above (which was composed by the end-users), users could edit and attach files to a standard Confluence page which could then be exported (both the references and attachments) in an EndNote-readable format. This would operate similarly to the current "PDF Export" option, etc.
{quote}
fields.summary: Export Confluence content to EndNote format

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1. Edit a page with long line of text
2. Place cursor somewhere in the long line of text
3. Invoke autocomplete. Drop down will appear in the correct location.
4. Cancel. Move cursor forward to somewhere in the long line of text (anywhere 'after' the previous cursor position).
5. Invoke autocomplete. The drop down will appear in the wrong location.
fields.summary: On shortcut autocomplete appears in the wrong location in IE

fields.description:
Please, undo CONF-17133 since the new *atlassian-user.xml* structure is too confusing.

For the Crowd integration, instead of just uncommenting a line (the Crowd Repository), now admins must comment or delete everything but the Crowd lines.

Many evaluators have already created support requests that were diagnosed as *atlassian-user.xml* wrong configuration.
fields.summary: Update the crowd integration comments in atlassian-user.xml
Editor: hints may refer to features that are disabled, so we should provide a way for administrators to control the displayed hints

fields.description:
* Edit a page with content covering >1 screen length
* Type [ or ! in the RTE to open the autocomplete dropdown
* Scroll the editor window

The dropdown remains stationary while the editor is scrolled. This is a bit weird from a usability point of view.

Suggestion is to have the dropdown cancelled whenever the editor is scrolled. 

Note: this should also apply to the full screen mode.
fields.summary: Autocomplete: dropdown remains stationary when the editor window is scrolled

fields.description:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-43919

*Theme:* Documentation Theme (no modifications, just the standard one that comes w/ confluence 3.1.x)

When adding a new page from the main dashboard, the newly added page is at the same level as Home in the target space. We are using the Documentation Theme which uses the Home page to be root. The newly added page is "lost" for the end user.

*The problem:*
* The home page is the root for the documentation theme
* If you create a page from the main dashboard and select a space that has the documentation theme, the page will be created at the same level as the home page.
* This makes it appear as though the page is not there. Anyone can go to the Pages section and move to the appropriate place.
* I'm asking that the Add -> Page to default to the home page set for the target space.

*Workaround:* just move the page after you create it.

*Fix:* instead of defaulting to the same level as the home page, default the new page to be under the space's Home Page.
fields.summary: Add Page from main dashboard doesn't default to placing the new page under Home
Edit in word doesn't work over different domains

fields.description:
Could there be an improvement to the search results view,
so that the results also display the full path location of the page?

Similar to the attachment result view.

*For example:*

We have 20 meeting reports with naming convention (meeting report DDMMYYY) in 1 space over different projects (parent pages).

If we do a search on meeting report, it is not clear, which search result is for which project.

Contact me for more info, or vote vor this issue if others agree.
Thanks in advance! I love the product :-)
fields.summary: Display breadcrumb path in Search Results

ReverseSort parameter for Gallery macro does not work

fields.description:
On the Confluence General Administration page, there is a link under *Feature Settings* that directs the Administrator to the plugin administration page.  Clicking on this link loads the <confluence>/admins/plugins.action page.

On the plugins.action page, an error message is generated at the top, which says (note, screenshot also attached):
{quote}
Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.
{quote}

This error occurs even if I just type the URL into a new browser and load the page.

I notice that when you click on the "Plugins" item in the configuration menu, the error message is not displayed.  However, the "Plugins" menu item directs the user to <confluence>/admin/viewplugins.action.

Although the two URLs are different, the rendered page appears to be identical (except for the error message that occurs in the first page).
fields.summary: /admin/plugins.action generates an error message on the resultant page

fields.description:
Both the attachments page view and the attachments macro can cause content to overlap the borders when there are attachments with long filenames.

See screenshots
fields.summary: Fixed Width Theme: Attachments view can overlap the borders

fields.description:
Clicking the yellow star icon *on the dashboard* triggers a POST to either /labels/addspacetofavorites.action or /labels/removespacefromfavorites.action

This triggers a 302 redirect to GET /spaces/viewpspacecontent.action

Although this isn't harmful persay, it is incorrect.  It shouldn't 302 and it should probably POST to /json/addspacetofavorites.action/
fields.summary: Favoriting Spaces causes needless 302 redirect

fields.description: I'm pretty sure I used to be able to select text in the RTE, then drag it to move it around on the page.  Right now if I select text and drag I get the "copy" icon rather than a "move" icon, but there's no insert point at the cursor location, and nothing happens on mouseUp, neither copy or move.
fields.summary: Can't select/drag a text selection to move it around in the RTE

fields.description:
The link dialog was a bit slow to appear when I clicked it on Extranet, so I clicked it again.

I ended up with a blank dialog on top of the link dialog, I think. The shadow was still present. I clicked the dialog and hit Escape. That removed the shadow, but the blank dialog remained as in the screenshot.

I can reproduce this quite easily on Extranet.

I've rated this as critical because I know some people double-click everything on a web page, including toolbar buttons. And even experienced people do it accidentally from time to time.

None of the other dialogs have the same problem, as far as I can tell. The insert image dialog and the macro browser still open if you double-click them.
fields.summary: Clicking Insert Link button twice displays blank dialog that can't be closed

fields.description:
After switching to using a JNDI Location to specify the mail server, when I went back to edit the Mail Server configuration, the "SMTP Host Address" field said "null:25".  The system wouldn't let me save my changes, and gave me the error "You cannot specify both a SMTP host and a JNDI location".  Had to clear the SMTP Host Address field.  Not a major issue, but slightly annoying.

To repeat the problem:

1. Create and Save new SMTP Mail Server (filling in SMTP Host Address)
2. Edit new SMTP Mail Server
3. Remove SMTP Host Address and fillin a JNDI location
4. Save Changes
5. Edit the mail server again.  SMTP Host Address will be "null:25"
fields.summary: SMTP Host Address textfield set to "null:25" after switching to JNDI Location

fields.description:
When you type the '!' trigger character you see a drop down with the images currently attached to the page.

If there are a few suggestions you may then start typing expecting to filter the suggestions. Instead a search is issued instead and you will most likely see a complete different set of results. This is quite unexpected. It is also inconsistent with how our "suggest" or quicknav works elsewhere in the application. Typically as you type in a suggest component the suggestions are refined by what you type.

Now someone is going to try and argue that this is an improvement and not a bug, but you are wrong. The current behaviour is a usability bug! :-)
fields.summary: Image autocomplete behaves in an inconsistent and misleading manner

fields.description:
When you type a few characters then the image autocomplete runs a search and suggests I think no more than 7 items. 
When you don't type any characters you get a suggestion of all the images on the page. This is too many to easily grasp (5 - 7 is the ideal number for your brain). The other concern is that in some edge cases you could have so many attachments that the thumbnail generation is a killer.
fields.summary: Too many autocomplete image suggestions for attachments on the page

fields.description:
The "Recently Viewed" tab in the "Move Page" dialogue just shows a spinning biscuit.

See attached screenshot.

FYI: I _can_ view my recently viewed history via the username menu.
fields.summary: The Recently Viewed tab in the Move Page dialogue hangs

fields.description:
See screencast:

http://www.screencast.com/users/mattnhodges/folders/Jing/media/5bdf8af0-a54e-46a2-b020-f579df5b60b7

Steps to reproduce:
1. Type trigger character [
2. Type some text
3. Select "search for text" in autocomplete to open the link browser
OR
1. Type some text
2. Click Ctrl+Shift+K
3. Select "search for text" in autocomplete to open the link browser

The link text is not the text that was typed. This behavior is inconsistent with just selecting text and opening the link browser. All three scenarios should be consistent and populate the link text with the user typed text.
fields.summary: Searching for a link using auto-complete replaces your link text with the search result

fields.description:
This is just a request/recommendation for a feature. It would be nice if it were an easily configurable option to have the links in the forgotmypassword-success page and the forgotmypassword email point to the changemypassword page rather than the site root as they currently do.

It seems like a good idea to steer a user in the direction of changing their password after generation a new one. We figured out how to make this change on our end, so we don't require any support. Just seemed like a practical thing to do, so I figured I'd send a feature request.
fields.summary: forgotmypassword email and forgotmypassword-success.vm links should go to password changemypassword page.

fields.description:
When Confluence.atlassian.com was upgraded to 3.2-beta2 from 3.1.1 (or 2?) the Velocity Helper plugin module was disabled.  This prevented the tree from showing.  This also happened on qa-cac, so presumably it's not a once-off and may happen to other customers.

Turning on the Velocity Helper from the plugins administration screen works and makes the tree work.  I'm yet to establish why this occurred or whether this will reoccur on a restart.  

A *possible* scenario is that this happens whenever we go from non-bundled doc theme to bundled doc theme.
fields.summary: Documentation theme tree vanished when upgrading to 3.2-beta2

fields.description:
When raising an issue at support.atlassian.com, a handy popup appears in the browser and delivers this message:
{quote}
Before you proceed, there is a feature we would like to bring to your attention. Your instance is capable of generating automatic support requests that include your log files, environment information and more. This information helps the support team give you a quicker and more effective response.

This feature can be found in your Administration Console. For more information please see the directions for [Raising a Support Request|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=12#TroubleshootingProblems%26RequestingTechnicalSupport-RaisingaSupportRequest].

Please consider using this feature if possible rather than manually creating the issue here.
{quote}

If you then visit your Confluence's Support Utility section under the Admin Console, the directions for raising an issue are as follows:
{quote}*Support Utility*
If you are having a problem and need to contact support, please:
1) Create a support request at http://support.atlassian.com
2) Turn on debugging at Logging and Profiling
3) Reproduce the issue
4) Create a support zip (below) and attach the support zip to the case.
{quote}

Then further down, this:
{quote}
*Raise Support Request*
If you cannot download the support zip and upload it to the support case, or cannot create a support case at http://support.atlassian.com, you may prefer to create a support request via the confluence administration. However, please note that this should only be done if you cannot create a support request or download the support zip (created above), as your mail server may not forward the message properly or in a timely manner, thus making the process more error prone than manually attaching the support zip to the case.
{quote}

Also, if you click the link for raising issues in the initial popup on SAC, you get this recommendation:
{quote}
* (Recommended) Raise a support ticket directly via our support site on the Internet and then create a support zip using the Support Utility below. The advantage of this method is that it includes all the relevant files confluence support need. You can also be sure that the support case has been created and includes your logs.
* Complete the support request form via your Confluence Administration Console. The disadvantage of this method is that your mail may not be forwarded correctly due to restrictions imposed by your mail server. For example, the zip of your log files might be too large for your mail server to forward them on.
{quote}

We recommend one thing on SAC, and another in Confluence and in the docs.  One consistent recommendation should be represented and the other noted as an alternative.  Due to the possibility of send mail issues mentioned in Confluence's Support utility page, it is probable better to remove the popup from SAC and sticking with the manual generation as the preferred step.
fields.summary: Inconsistent instructions for raising support issues in Confluence and at support.atlassian.com

E.g. IE 6 uses "application/x-zip-compressed" for docx files.

The drag 'n drop upload has a similar problem.

See CONF-17718
fields.summary: Fix mime type for attachment file uploads.

fields.description:
When editing a page, the page saves a draft of what you are typing every so often.

If you lose connection to the page, a red message pops up telling you it cannot save the draft.

For some reason this cannot be seen in Safari on EAC.

On a side note, if you stop running your local instance of Confluence it doesn't work for any of the browsers.
fields.summary: Draft auto-saving message when there is a connection error is not visible in Safari

fields.description:
*Problem:* Office Connector tries to download crossdomain.xml from http://crossdomain.xml, which does not exist.

This file belongs in */templates/extra/conversion/crossdomain.xml*, part of Office Connector's jar file.

When one visits a page with a viewfile macro, the plugin will try to download crossdomain.xml (as a URL) rather than correctly specifying it as a resource to be retrieved from Confluence. In doing so, it tries to download from http://crossdomain.xml - causing a http 502 error code.

In a reported case, this slows performance for viewfile macros eg. by 10 seconds as the proxy server tries to search for this url.
fields.summary: Viewfile macro performance problems
Auto-suggest groups as an administrator types it in the group search text field
Bundled Templates: Problems with the instruction: They should contain info about how to create the plugin archetyp

Bundled Templates: Following the instructions <http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Creating+A+Template+Bundle> resulted in a plugin that did nothing. I think the instructions aren't finished.
There is no way for new users to know about having to enable the context menu.

Pasting a URL into the link box when inserting a link does nothing - it should add that as a link directly to the page. To do this you need to change tab and then add it. Even then you need to fill out two fields to add one link.
Editing an existing link with the new link dialog and changing the link text will result in a broken link. e.g. produces: "[[My Hoose 2|Home]|Home]"
